subject: Ethics
title: Mass Surveillance vs Targeted Surveillance
description: A quick win: understand Mass Surveillance vs Targeted Surveillance.

hook.text: Police tapping a suspect's phone? Most accept that. Tapping everyone's phone to maybe find a suspect? Hmm.

buildup.text: Targeted surveillance focuses on specific individuals with evidence. Mass surveillance collects everyone's data first.

discovery.text: Supporters say mass surveillance catches threats early. Like fishing with a massive net instead of a single line.

twist.text: But studies show mass surveillance rarely stops attacks. A 2013 review found the NSA's bulk program stopped zero.

climax.text: Mass surveillance trades everyone's privacy for a tool that mostly catches false positives, not real threats.

punchline.text: Watching everyone means understanding no one.

quiz.question: What did a 2013 review find about NSA bulk data collection?
options: It stopped dozens of terrorist attacks
